I'll say up front that I purchased this because (a) I wanted some Android OS experience under my belt, (b) I liked the idea of expandability with the mini-SD slot, and (c) the price point ($149) was so much better than a similarly configured iPad mini - or even other Android tablets.In response to other reviews, my unit has no build issues - doesn't feel flimsy, the glass doesn't seem *that* much different than iPad glass; the SD card has remained seated and non-problematic; and I'm finding the OS to be fairly easy to deal with. Interestingly, iOS 7 seems to have stolen a few things from the Android OS!If I had it to do over again, I'd buy this again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Asus card issues update & Streaming Amazon videos
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Received my tablet Asus memo pad HD 7, 16 GB, Sept. 19 2013.  Polaroid 16 GB high speed class 10 micro SDHC flash memory card.  The display is easy for me to see, I have poor vision.Can use Google calender offline and sync when online.Google drive works well.  Also installed a swipe keyboard, it works great. Found a tablet anti virus program, AVG.Loaded my music to the sd card and created a play list.  Played music with loaded software, sounded great.Tried loading a Kindle book, but can not find it!Up to now I am loving this tablet.  The touch screen is sluggish. Takes 2-3 taps to activate apps at random moments.Today, 3rd day of use, the tablet will not access the sd card, then it does!  Again, it is random when it will work.This keeps up, the tablet will be useless to me, so back it will go!Asus support wants $38 to chat with me on the issues!  This will end up a $400 tablet by the time support gets done with me!9/28/13 Update:SD Card Issue:I tried the power off/reinsert and power on reinsert, neither worked.  I put in a older micro SD (Patriot 4 GB, not a class 10) card and it has stayed mounted for 4 days now and is playing music from it.  I put the Polaroid card in my cell phone and it works.  Asus support suggested trading out the SD card.  I don't know if it is an issue with class 10 or Polaroid, Asus only said if another card did not work, it was a card reader issue, nothing about the type of card or brand being an issue.Support responded with 3 days.Registering device:when you register your device, it says to look for the Serial number on the product box.  On my box the serial number clearly contained a zero (0), even by Asus's check list of what a zero & an O would look like.On my device, Settings Icon/ System section/ About tablet/ Status, I found the device serial number that worked to register my device, which showed an O, not 0 (zero)Suggestion for Asus: DON'T USE THE LETTERS O & I IN SERIAL NUMBERS!Google Docs:It has been really easy to up-load Word and Excel docs from my main computer.  The down side is I have not found away to edit them yet.  Still exploring that.  I can create new docs on my Asus and convert them to Word or Excel on the computer.I can't give it 5 stars with Asus not making it clear if class 10 cards will work or not, plus the registering issue.Oct. 13: I have been using a Transcend 32gb Class 10 MicoSD and have not had any issues with it.Streaming Amazon videos (you will need to download Flash): I tried Dolphin browser, but it stopped working and hanging up the system. Was very difficult to get flash on it.  I am now using Puffin browser for 5 days, It was very easy to get Flash on it.issues:  1. Has a bit of lag when streaming, but not always  2. Not easy to get it to open to full screen. Not really sure how I got it to go to full screen!ASUS MeMOPad HD 7-Inch 16 GB Tablet, White (ME173X-A1-WH)

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: TPerki
Reviews.Content: I have another ASUS tablet, so not much new here. Updated to latest Android when I powered it up. I really like the form factor. I have a 10" Transformer (TF300T). I pretty much keep it in the keyboard dock, as 10" is hard to hold in your hand. 7" is much easier, and you don't sacrifice that much screen for normal day to day stuff. That said, I bought the MeMoPad as a "front end" for Google Play Music and ChromeCast. I connect the MeMo to my Bose Wave Radio using bluetooth and stream cast to the TV using ChromeCast (check it out, it is wild for the money).

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy without the high price
Reviews.Author: Maxx
Reviews.Content: I am completely sold on this unit, unlike the 172, the 173 handles very well.No lag, very easy set up, and best of all the micro SD. (Nexus,I pads, Kindles are missing this)It will NOT support a 64 GB micro. a 32 GB is the max.Special Notes...Apps are stored on device. Not SD card..so use care on what you get.A Protective outer case is HIGHLY recommended.Battery life is amazing! ( on power saver expect 12-15 hours, my personal experience)Movies on SD card play beautifully!Games like Plants vs Zombies load slow but play as normal.I'm super happy about this little unit,I wanted a unit with alot without the price tag.If your looking for the same..here it is.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: As far as a "budget" Android tablet goes, this thing is amazing.  I have owned several tablets over the years and this is the most impressive, especially considering price.  My wife has the 1st gen Nexus 7 and this thing, in my opinion is as nice or nicer than it.Some things of note: screen is amazing, the colors are good and images crisp, the SD card slot is very handy and one of the factors that led me to buy this over the new Nexus 7, the camera is so-so, but for a pinch (and in the right lighting...) it's not bad, Asus UI is probably the least intrusive custom UI on the market.  It's also pretty quick, thanks in part to good mid range hardware as well as a light UI.  I don't really play games but the following played well: Plants vs. Zombies, Gun Bros 2 and Dungeon Hunter 4.  Fit and finish isn't bad, the back plate feels a bit flimsy, but once in a case it's a moot point.  Music sounds good, videos look good, the internal speakers are good enough.  I'm just really quite impressed with this little tablet.  I'm very happy to have spent about $150 on this instead of $230 on the new Nexus 7, but your mileage may vary.

Reviews.Title: Really nice little device.
Reviews.Author: soki
Reviews.Content: The lack of a camera flash, and no mini hdmi jack are hardly missed. Plug a bid sd class 10 card into it and the thing runs android absolutely seamlessly and open all files/app in a snap. Best value out the dollar for dollar. We'll see in a year if the construction is good enough. Bought this and paired it to some decent Bluetooth speakers for my father to replace his old CD player set up (transoding hell but well worth it).

Reviews.Title: Awesome Tablet, extraordinary price AUG26
Reviews.Author: Brian M.
Reviews.Content: This thing is fast at processing. Copy and paste from a micro SD is speedy even when doing gigs at a time. On standby with bluetooth on does 24 hours easily. Sound from speaker is great but on my bluetooth headphones amazing. The Asus apps built in are fun to use and each serve a purpose. The buttons feel good and are very responsive. The multitask works with no lag and apps start in the blink of an eye. Tablet feels great in hand and is very lightweight and thin.BUY ONE NOW, IF YOU CAN BUY 2 BECAUSE EVERYONE WHO SEES YOU WITH IT WILL WANT TO TRY IT. I wanted another one but spent cash right before the semester so Nexus 7 2 didn't make the cut and this is the true winner.

Reviews.Title: A piece of trash
Reviews.Author: teddyb
Reviews.Content: Well after reading the reviews on here, i can see there are a mixture of experiences; mostly positive, unfortunately, mine was not a good one. Very disappointed with this Asus product. Purchased this as a Christmas gift for my son December 14th 2013. After one month of use, the tablet failed to respond. Thinking maybe it was just a defect, I ordered a replacement. The tablet worked great for about 4 months then suddenly stopped working again, now i can't return it because the warranty has expired. I'm basically stuck with a heap of junk that i can do nothing with, only had the item for a total of four months. Now I'm out of a tablet and $144.00. I would not recommend this product to anyone. Take my advise, if you happen to come across one that you're having problems with and you're considering sending in for a replacement, DON'T, get your money back and be done with it. Would give it a rating of zero if i could.

Reviews.Title: SAME PROBLEM OTHER 1 STAR RATINGS ARE HAVING
Reviews.Author: Deb Brinker
Reviews.Content: RECEIVED MY ME-173X-A1-BL FOR CHRISTMAS. ON OFF SWITCH WAS HARD TO TURN ON AND OFF. WORKED FOR 5 DAYS COULD NOT GET IT TO POWER ON. TOOK IT BACK FOR A NEW ONE THIS ONE DIDN'T LAST A DAY. WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER ASUS PRODUCT AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: It stop worked on 3rd day...
Reviews.Author: Song Sopher
Reviews.Content: I bought Asus Memopad for my husband for christmas and he loved it. It has everything he needed for work and personal. But on 3rd day, It stoped working and charging.  Somehow I got it to start the power and it keep dying, It was charged over nigt but it says charged 15%.  Than I start smell some wire burnnng and it was coming from charger cord.  I took back to store and they told me to order it online. They discontinue Asus Memopad!  I read other reviews and seems alke many buyer had same issues. I won't go trouble to get another Asus. Although it is great tablet, wish they fix the issue and make new model. but for now NO, I won't recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for about 2 months
Reviews.Author: Texasweety
Reviews.Content: I loved this but one day it started freezing and turned completely off. I let it die for 2 days and recharged it completely and it worked fine for another week. I would have to do this  at least once a week but now it won't do anything. I can't charge it, no buttons work. its a wrap and I'm so upset.

Reviews.Title: Dead after one month - no charge, won't start. Dead.
Reviews.Author: Brooke
Reviews.Content: Died after one month of use. Would not charge or power up. I tried the two recommended ways to get it to 'wake up', but it's a brick.

Reviews.Title: Big Bang, for a Little Budget!
Reviews.Author: E.M. Browne "erichitscar"
Reviews.Content: Very impressed so far! I've had the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 for about a year, and it was a fantastic tablet.  During that time, we had our first child, and now he loves anything that Mom and Dad hold in there hands. ie, our tablets and phones.  Worried that I would have to replace a $400 tablet because of drool, or it being dropped, we set out on a search for something a bit cheaper.We bought a used first gen kindle fire, and it was okay, but it was too slow, and we didn't like being tied to Amazon for everything. More research, lot's of web browsing and by accident I came across a blog about underrated tablets for under $200.  The Asus Memo Pad HD 7 was on that list!  I was intrigued, and started reading reviews on line, and found a sweet deal here on Amazon! for $129, this tablet is a great bargain!I've been using it for about a week now, and it is fast, the picture is great!, the screen is responsive and bright!My initial worries about buying a cheap tablet have been put to rest.  I will update this review after a month or so of use to give a deeper detailed review, but for now, at $129, this has been a great purchase!

Reviews.Title: excellent tablet
Reviews.Author: Diane M.
Reviews.Content: After having a very disappointing experience with a previous tablet I had ordered,  I cautiously decided to order the Asus Memopad.  I  absolutely love this tablet.  I have been able to get the games I like to play with no fees,  I have been enjoying books to read from Amazon free since theMEMO PAD comes with Kindle already installed.  I do all of my email easily and will be able to use Skype to contact family.  There are many things already installed which has made using the tablet very helpful.If someone is on the fence about giving this tablet a try, I would encourage them to go for it.  I believe, from my experience, they will be happy if they are needing a tablet easy to use and having many programs already installed. I do not need a tablet that has high technical abilities though this tablet  can likely accommodate someone who wants that.I hope this review will be of help.Diane

Reviews.Title: Tablet For The Ages
Reviews.Author: Michael Kerner "Michael Kerner"
Reviews.Content: There is no question that everyone is looking for a tablet, and ways to stay communicated with others on the go. But with so many different electronics out there these days, it can be a difficult decision. Tablets have came a long way since the Palm Pilots and the Iphone 6 years ago. But everyone has been on the Apple Ipad bandwagon since it came out 3 years ago. But with all of that, many might want to feel they are not wasting their money on one company, or just one product either. But with tablets it is very hard to find, not just in speed, but in battery life as well. ASUS has just gone into the tablet game awhile ago, and they have definitely a lot to prove with every other computer company as well. Well, there have been so many tablets on the market, but they have fell shy, not just in price, but productivity. Well, ASUS has tried their latest to the test, and it fairly does the job well.The ASUS MeMoPad HD 7 is definitely one of those tablets worth checking out not just in battery life, but also in playback and speed to get online as well. It has good wi-fi connections to get online, without the hassle of getting into a 3G network, good media playback and noble speed. What I do like about it is that it is very simple and easy to understand after a little time, and not longer unlike other tablets. I also like the fact that on this one you have a storage space for your external memory with a micro SD card expansion slot. This I like, because you can get more with a fraction of what you would pay for the Ipad. You can store as much as a 32 GB Micro SD Card, and it works nicely. What I did have a bit of a tough time with it though was trying to get online, but after awhile I found it quite easy. It also has good bluetooth connections as well, so you can use a wireless device flawlessly with it, from headphones to a computer keyboard. What I do wish for is that it would have better voice recognition, it has just as much of a lackluster connection as is with Apple's Suri voice recognition.  But at the end of the day, it works out mostly well for its money.All in all, if you really are looking for a tablet for yourself, I definitely suggest you give the ASUS MeMoPad a try. It definitely is a nice alternative to tablets that are more popular from the Barnes & Noble's Nook to the Apple Ipad and Ipad Mini. You really get nearly everything you want in a tablet or a smartphone, without the hassle in price. This is definitely a tablet I like from the speed and the connectivity, to a better value for your games, and communicating with others on the go. This is a nice device, and I suggest you give this one a shot.Price: BSetup: B+Convience: A-Battery Life: BOverall: B 1/2+

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: rnd402
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet for a week now and it is working super. I have loaded a few apps and watched a couple movies and have experienced no glitches. I highly recommend this tablet. The price is right too.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievably Nice For The Money
Reviews.Author: Joe L
Reviews.Content: I highly reccomend this tablet. It is quick with little to no lag, bright and responsive touch screen, and the Android OS 4.2.1 runs nicely. Almost vanilla rom with very little bloatware, which is nice compared to most other brands that load their devices up with unneccesary applications in order to make a quick advertising buck.For the other geeks out there that plan on rooting, there is a one-click root method already out that doesn't even require the user to use a pc.Great tablet.

Reviews.Title: Bought 2 of them and both are dead after one week
Reviews.Author: Bruno de Abreu Moraes
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 for my kids and after one week it simply got dead.Doesn't turn on.Apart form this horrible problem, it was ok.Hope ASUS help to sort this out.

Reviews.Title: having terrible luck with these tablets
Reviews.Author: kat
Reviews.Content: Got 2 tablets for my sons for Christmas and the first one stopped working--simply wouldn't turn on anymore- by mid-February.  Had to ship it to TX to the Asus service center where they replaced the battery. It took almost 2 weeks for the repair and then they shipped it back to me via FedEx with signature required.  As I work full time during business hours I was unable to be home to sign for the package.  FedEx told me to ask Asus to change that requirement and Asus refused to help. I was lucky enough to have an ex-husband close to the FedEx station an hour away, and he was able to get the tablet, but it delayed getting the tablet back for my son for another week. It was torture for my 8-year old to be without his favorite toy for almost a month.  Then the second tablet quit working in April! Same problem. I paid another $15 to ship it to Asus. This time the screen got cracked in shipping (?? I had it wrapped good in bubble wrap and newspaper!) and they sent me an email a week later saying I needed to pay $161 for a new LCD screen. I replied saying I wasn't going to be able to pay that when it was more than the tablet was worth, and I waited to hear back. No reply for week. So I emailed again, did 3 live online "chats" with Asus and was just told to email again to ask if the tablet could be fixed without fixing the screen each time. Finally on May 23 (a full month from when they received the tablet) I heard back via email from Asus saying they would not fix the tablet without fixing the screen first. I replied saying to please ship it back to me to my workplace so I could sign for it there.  I received a generic email on 5/27 saying they would reply within 48 hours and have not heard anything since then.  My next move is to spend part of my 1 hour of time after my sons go to bed calling Asus to see if they will send back my son's tablet. I will have to find someone else to fix the screen before I have to ship it back to Asus if I want it to work again.  I have already had to purchase a new tablet (a Kindle Fire) so that my boys would each have a tablet to play with.  This has been the worst experience I've ever had with a product.  I would have accepted the bad battery on the first tablet as bad luck, but to have both of them quit working within 4 months says to me that Asus is not a good quality product. I am very frustrated and disappointed, and I will never purchase an Asus product again.

Reviews.Title: Major issues
Reviews.Author: buyermike
Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these MeMo Pads (for me and my girlfriend) and after only a few months both are dead. After researching the issue I discovered this to be a known issue with ASUS and have seen dozens of complaints pertaining to battery failure. I am still waiting to hear back from ASUS on this issue, and will repost once I hear what they plan to do to resolve this. I have heard several people say that ASUS is not standing behind their products like they used to so I really hope that is not the case. It really to bad because when it was working I thought it was a pretty good little unit. Until this is resolved with the manufacturer I cannot recommend this product at any price point, unless you wish you throw money away.

Reviews.Title: The battery could last longer
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: It also takes way to long to charge, I'd say about three times longer to fully charge it than it takes to drain the battery. Even turned off it takes over 5 hours to reach a full charge

Reviews.Title: used to love it but now it won't turn on
Reviews.Author: Wes
Reviews.Content: Was very happy the first 60 days or so that we got it.  But tonight, it won't turn on.Searched the web and reviews here.  Apparently this is common.  YES COMMON!Asus - NEVER AGAIN!Very disappointing . Out $140...

Reviews.Title: love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Alice M Navarro
Reviews.Content: Brought this for my 70 yr old mom. She loves it and truthfully I like it more than my kindle fire Hd. Thinking of getting myself one soon.

Reviews.Title: Loved this...past tense
Reviews.Author: sueshire
Reviews.Content: This was a great little tablet. I purchased it in February of this year (2014). No problems at all until yesterday, when for no reason that I could find, it simply would not turn on after charging. Checked user blogs and apparently others have had this same issue. I tried trickle charging, as recommended, tried the reset button after tearing my house apart looking for a paper clip to use as a tool, and finally smacked it a time or two (not recommended). It's about a month past the warranty period, so it is now a paperweight. I should have spent a little extra and got the iPad mini I wanted.

Reviews.Title: disappointed!!@
Reviews.Author: James Hawkins Jr
Reviews.Content: Not a great tablet get a galaxy... Disappointed!!! Jerky movement no flash player bad touch sensability I wish I could get my money back!!!

Reviews.Title: Suck !!
Reviews.Author: victor heng
Reviews.Content: Something just so wrong with the design, the start button just quit on you. Back to back same problem with the replacement.

Reviews.Title: I bought 2 for Christmas, neither worked
Reviews.Author: Rollo Tomassi "pinzone"
Reviews.Content: I bought two for Christmas.  They turned on about 3 times each, and did not turn on after that.  I send one back, which cost me 40 dollars-- in the end.  And I am on the phone with Asus customer support right now with the second for the same reason.It worked well when it would start and run.  But sometimes it just would not start.  I'd hold the button down for 15 second-- or 10 years.  It just won't turn on.I really think these were made and rushed out for selling.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working in 5 months
Reviews.Author: Luna Kot
Reviews.Content: I purchased it in November and it was my first tablet and first Asus product ever. It worked more or less fine till today, except never-ending annoying intro while it was charging. Unfortunately, it stopped turning on since this morning, just from nowhere - I am always very careful with my electronics. I contacted customer service, and they couldn't proceed with the RMA because their return system is dead, meaning that I will have to bug them and waste my time again later. After that I will have to pay for shipping and wait for another who knows how long to get it back.I am very skeptical about considering another Asus device in future. Anybody who is thinking of purchasing Memo Pad, please, read all types of the review before. I did it too late - it looks like this kind of problem is very common with Memo Pads.UPDATE: I just got the tablet back. It works now, BUT there is a huge ~ 3 inch SCRATCH across the screen which was not there before!!! Can you imagine this?! I do not even know what has been done with my tablet since there is no feedback documentation included with the return package. I assume that they either replaced my tablet with some refurbished junk or made the scratch themselves during the repair.I have few questions to ASUS representatives now: why do you treat your customers as if you follow a simple rule "sell and forget"? Do you want people to purchase your products again? For me it looks like you do not want returning customers at all. Final question: what should I do with the tablet and the scratch now?

Reviews.Title: Poor customer service for faulty device
Reviews.Author: TangledJeansAndBeans
Reviews.Content: I loved this at the start, but slowly things started going wrong. The touch screen only works some of the time. I have found that changing the orientation then back again will bring it back to life. A bit of a pain, but that keeps it working.No updates since buying this so I am stuck with the foibles in the lock-screen launcher. The drop-down main menu leaves artifacts on the screen that can only be removed by a reboot. It randomly drops wifi, the list is long.The ASUS customer service has to be the worst in the world. They are nice, friendly, supportive and interested in the issues but they then dispense useless advice. After an hour+ wasted on the phone several times, they could not resolve any of the issues. I am not sure if they hung up on me, or the line just dropped out, but that happened on three wasted calls.I sent it in for repairs, they kept it three weeks and sent it back with NOTHING different. A total waste of time and money. I now only have this in the bathroom (where it belongs) where I can sit and read a few pages of a book. For anything else it is getting to be useless.I used to be a fan of ASUS, but this is my last ASUS purchase and that's a pity as we are in the market for two 8" win 8.1 tablets, but the vendor list just got shorter by one.Hopefully someone from ASUS will be reading these bad reviews on customer service (there are LOT here) and do something about it. This is like Dell back around the 2000 era when they were regarded as the best, until let down by poor customer service. It took them more than three years to recover. Amazon moderators reviewing this before publication could do ASUS a favor and get them to read a few of the bad reviews as they used to be great product manufacturers.

Reviews.Title: great little tablet
Reviews.Author: Jim in PA
Reviews.Content: The only complaint is all the extra crap software that gets loaded on it at the factory that you can't remove without root access.

Reviews.Title: Nexus for half price
Reviews.Author: jfink11
Reviews.Content: This thing is great. I use it all the time. My wife always steals it from me. Much lighter and easier than iPad. Plus it's android so it works with our phones. I like the expandable memory slot also. I haven't had a single problem with it in the last 3 months I've had it. The battery last long just like the iPad even though they say it's only rated 7 hours.

Reviews.Title: Dont wast your $$$$
Reviews.Author: Adam Bedard
Reviews.Content: got this for my daughter for christmas and I sent it in once because the screen kept freezing and you couldnt do anything on it. Just got in back 3 weeks ago and the same thing is happening again. should have just put the money we wasted on this and put towards an ipad mini. I know we wouldnt have had any issues like this in just a few months of having it !!!

Reviews.Title: 5th month review Just randomly died after a few months use.  Problems with features.
Reviews.Author: Mikhail Tagallie "PuppyOfDoom"
Reviews.Content: hey yall i bought this end of nov been playing with it dec jan feb thismarch it just died. randomly while charing connected to my laptop, it wont charge i use the cable provided. i use the wall outlet an connect it to my pc often enough.  its just dead. the cable works. i can charge my phone with it also.This is the second product ASUS has failed me on hardcore. the last one was a MOBO. i was like lemme give these guys a chance seems like a sweet deal good specs.Dont waste your money. also the Camera has a problem with the way it takes mirror pics and you have to manually mirror everything yourself when taking self photos. it wont save like you see it. itll save as a mirrored image.  its quite ackward and frustrating.  Find a better tablet dont waste your money like i did. Im thinking clearly here. not angry at the company just quite dissapointed in the product and its random dying. i didnt drop the thing or crush it i was careful with it. it just felt like dying.Im quite sad too i had some videos of my cat n some stuff on there. i cant retrieve it.

Reviews.Title: stopped working after 1-2 months
Reviews.Author: Beth Brassfield
Reviews.Content: We ordered this for our daughter for Christmas and after 1 month it simply stopped working.  We returned it and Amazon immediately replaced it but again after 1 1/2 months it just refused to charge or turn on.  Amazon was great about returning it for a full refund but we will not be purchasing this again.

Reviews.Title: Get a different tablet
Reviews.Author: CaptJax
Reviews.Content: Garbage. I bought my first one and the SD slot stopped working almost immediatly. I returned it and got a new one. The second one stopped working outright about three days after the 90 day warranty expired. It's now an expensive paperweight.

Reviews.Title: %50 failure in 3 months
Reviews.Author: Reviewer13
Reviews.Content: We ordered 6 of these for our 6 kids for Christmas.  We were very happy with the device and the price but ultimately 3 of them had completely failed within 3 months.  One kept over heating and shutting down even when not in the case.  One refused to turn on after awhile and we tried all the solutions that we read about online and it didn't work.  The third started having areas of the touch screen that quit being responsive to touch.  Two of these went bad soon enough to be able to get replacements for free but the third one didn't.  Also, we expect that we will see the same sort of failure rate with the new devices as we did originally and that we will have more trouble with the ones that haven't went bad yet.

Reviews.Title: this tablet were you looking
Reviews.Author: Jose Mendoza Peña
Reviews.Content: I really like this tablet is what I was looking for .. and with a memory capacity of more than 32 is complete ..

Reviews.Title: Very Good Display
Reviews.Author: NH Camper
Reviews.Content: I do not have alot of experiences with tablet but the picture is awesome and it surf very well.Excellent streaming from Netflix

Reviews.Title: Best Pad, Great Price
Reviews.Author: Thomas Aycock Jr.
Reviews.Content: Best Pad under 200.00 with more improved features like memory slot and front camera over the Google Nexus. Best price & quick shipping

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: christian
Reviews.Content: This is a great product that is very inexpensive and does what other tablets say they do. I own the three major tablets and this one is right on par with the rest.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet but....
Reviews.Author: robyn
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet as a Christmas gift, on the first day, the charger didnot work out of the package. Contacted Amazon and reordered a new charger. Some three months later, the charger is once again no longer working. Amazon cheerfully helped me after two attempts to contact ASUS and being hung up on by their customer servcie representatives.ASUS needs to learn customer service! If given the opportunity to buy this tablet or another comperable tablet, I would definitely not purchase an ASUS product again!

Reviews.Title: Perfect except battery/charging issue
Reviews.Author: Walton Macey
Reviews.Content: perfect for the price, battery charging issue after a month. I have to return it under the factory warranty. Tablet will not turn on or indicate that it is charging.

Reviews.Title: 8 days and will not power on again BUT  READ UPDATE
Reviews.Author: Manfred K. Dulle
Reviews.Content: 8 days working.. liked it.. will not power on.. RMA  at my expense.. DEVOUT ASUS FAN,, motherboards and video cards.. THIS IS  J U N K  ...  UPDATE  ASUS  tech support, accepted an RMA and in 13 days I had a BRAND NEW one back in my hands.. It has worked flawlessly..Apparently there is some glitch with these devices, that hard locks the machine if you let battery go 100 % dead .. Asus claims it is software related, and FIXED at thisa point..  THIS  tablet takes INCREDIBLE PHOTO's  All in all I WOULD reccomend it at this point.. But it was a rocky road getting there.. ASUS  has never let me down and again they come through!

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Javier Duque
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item thinking it was a very great buy. I was sorely disappointed. After completing the initial set up, I received a notification telling me to update the system. I let it download/install, it has been stuck on "installing system update".

Reviews.Title: Thought I wouldn't be writing this one star review!
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I bought the tablet as a gift for my six year old son and from the beginning battery issues. The battery would last 1 hour and take 7 to charge, three weeks later wouldn't take a charge or power up. I give amazon's return department 5 stars. I didn't want to pay for shipping to asus three weeks after I bought it, and get refurb after refurb with the same issue. I thought twice about getting this tablet glad it wasn't to late to return. Who knows buy one have it break and asus might send you mine refurbished and it'll last you 3 weeks like me. Don't make that mistake get a Samsung or Apple tablet bottom line YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR.

Reviews.Title: 4 Months and its a paperweight...
Reviews.Author: Shawn Mckean
Reviews.Content: Purchased this on October 4, 2013, by February 18th its a paperweight.  Asus customer support is a bit difficult to get ahold of and the squaretrade warranties sold by amazon only cover the period after the manufacturers warranty expires..

Reviews.Title: Sorry but device stopped working in less than a month of use
Reviews.Author: JG "lovetoread"
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for my mother who used it to occasionally check email and play candy crush.  It just stopped working. Easy return  with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Bright display, love the interface
Reviews.Author: RickMay57
Reviews.Content: Device works great right out of the box with 1 exception, purchased device with an memory card, and every time I move the device, it says that the memory card was unexpectantly removed... the card was not removed. I suspect a mechanical issue but have not sent it in for repair yet.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: ttucker
Reviews.Content: We had to exchange it 2 times and both times it did not even work.  My sister had purchased one also and the screens cracked very easily.  Of the 2 we purchased they both ended up getting sent back and Samsung tab 3's were ordered in place of the memo pad.

Reviews.Title: good device
Reviews.Author: Paul Malcher "Paul M"
Reviews.Content: I am going to be direct here it's a really good device. Unless your look looking for high end hardware or gammimg hardware specifically. I bought it for media such as Netflix and to replace my nook. It's does a fantastic job without being slow or having a bad screen. I used to have a Lenovo ideatab which was okay but my years of owning a high end smartphone made me want better. This fit the bill perfectly. Handles multitasking well, mostly stock android with a few asus additions all of which are pretty good. This is also one of many asus products I own and thus far it lives up to what I expect quality wise from asus. Bottom line if you want a cheap but good and capable tablet this is it.

Reviews.Title: Good for less than a day
Reviews.Author: Robert "Robert"
Reviews.Content: I guess it's a game of luck with this product.  Either you get one that works, or you get one that doesn't.  From the get-go, it took numerous tries to get the thing to turn on.  Then after less than a day, it just died.  In the brief time it worked, it was fine.  I ended up sending it back and getting a different brand and more expensive tablet.  Amazon service was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: Nice Little Tablet
Reviews.Author: Topper Shopper
Reviews.Content: In addition to all the good things the other reviews have stated, I started to take this tablet on overseas trips instead of my small laptop. It's not just lighter; you don't have to take it out of bag when going through airport security, just like a kindle!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy!
Reviews.Author: Nadia H
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item thinking it was a very great buy. I was sorely disappointed. Bought it as a Christmas present and by January the tablet failed to accept charge and would not power on. Returned it to amazon for a replacement. Same thing happened again!!! This time i want a refund. who knows if i'll get it because the window for return is shorter than before.  There is a saying in my country that cheap things ain't good and good things ain't cheap. This is definitely the case with this tablet. Save your money and purchase a  better tablet and brand!

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet for the money...
Reviews.Author: Monica
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these for my two granddaughters.  I could not have done better for Holiday presents.  They were so happy. Connected right away to wifi and the screens are so bright and beautiful.I would have gotten one for me except that I need mine 4G-4G, so I went with the Sprint Galaxy 3 Tab.  These are as fast and skinnier and slicker looking.  I love my Galaxy tab 3, but these are really great!I now have one ASUS monitor and my grands two tablets. Very happy with all of them.  Good job ASUS!

Reviews.Title: great fast tablet
Reviews.Author: Brian Hall
Reviews.Content: Great tablet fast and battery last a long time top of the line for the price you can't beat this tablet.

Reviews.Title: love love love it...great for my 10 year old but i also love it..looks and works great
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: Perfect size works great very compatible battery life is long lasting.. it is just a great tablet does everything i hoped it would

Reviews.Title: Dies in less than a month.
Reviews.Author: Chad Kruse
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my wife for Christmas; I was between two tablets and chose to go with the ASUS with the hope that name brand would support and deliver a better product.  Within a week of receiving the tablet it suddenly for no reason died and would not turn on.  We returned the tablet and received a new one; this one lasted 3 weeks this time before going black.  The tablet was only outside it's protective case for the 5 minutes it took to open the box and transfer to the case.  The tablet was never dropped or anything of that nature.  Extremely disappointed in this product and will think twice before purchasing anything ASUS in the future.

Reviews.Title: Quick crash
Reviews.Author: Michael Covellone
Reviews.Content: After 3 days the tablet crashed and I had to send it back to the manufacturer for repair. I just got it back - we'll see!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet While It Lasted
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: It was a great tablet for a couple of months then it stopped working.  The tablet no longer turns on or charges.  ASUS customer service was no help.  After doing some research on how to fix the problem, I found many people with the same problem but no solution.If you are going to get it, purchase it with an insurance plan or just get a better tablet.

Reviews.Title: Technical Issues After Recharging
Reviews.Author: stevegso
Reviews.Content: I ordered TWO of these tablets as gifts - one works just fine and the second wouldn't restart after being charged the first time.  Amazon was great - we returned the defective tablet and they sent us a replacement.  The replacement tablet has the SAME issue...it worked once, but after charging the second time it would not turn on.  Went through all the procedures mentioned online about finding a fix.  Nothing worked.  We are returning the second tablet and will get a refund.  In the mean time, the first tablet still works just fine!  So, one out of three tablets worked.  Not good odds, if you ask me!  I can only give one star, even though the first tablet works great.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Vaibhav
Reviews.Content: Cheap, reliable and sturdy. It serves all the purpose of a basic user. Only problem is that sound crackles at high volume.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Michael T. Boschert
Reviews.Content: Bought two of these for my daughters 8 & 7, to replace aging Lenovo tablets. White for one, Pink for the other.Had originally purchased the Galaxy Tab 3 7.0 but didn't realize they only had 8GB ROM, lesser screen quality, and older processor.The Asus is perfect, long battery life, nice screen, and runs great. It is a little laggy scrolling in the App drawer, but it is a huge upgrade over the Lenovo A2100 from just Dec 2012.There was an immediate updated to JellyBean 4.2.2 not sure of the enhancements as ASUS has its own skin. There are some Apps that come preloaded from ASUS, have tested them so cannot comment.It does have a Parental lock that can be setup and then monitored via web browser to set and change device time allowances. But it has to be activated each time the tablet is turned on, so not very efficient.Since they are for my girls , I haven't played with them too much outside of initial setup. As an e-reader/video streaming device it is great. Kids games it works great too.The only device I would have gotten over this would have been the LG GPad 8.3 or Kindle Fire HD(X). The Fire simply because I just found out about the Amazon Prime being being able to download video on demand for offline use and the build in Parental Lock features But the lack of expansion and full Play Store gets me.Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Amazing tablet
Reviews.Author: Christopher T. Owens "revbones"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift and when setting it up was blown away by the responsiveness, screen clarity and overall speed.  I personally have an Asus Transformer Infinity and a Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Ed so I went in with low expectations.  While the resolution obviously wasn't at the Note 10.1 2014's level, it was crystal clear and for the size I didn't note any jaggedness or pixilation.  The speed was on par with any other tablet and just felt zippy.I'm not sure you can get a better deal for the price.  I certainly couldn't find one and was really happy with it as a gift but I honestly wouldn't have minded one for myself.Whole-heartedly recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: the best !!!!
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: The screen rez and size alone make it a five star tablet but then add it's ability to do everything else , to much to go in to for a short review but I will say the only thing it may not be the best with would be graphically heavy games but that's not why I have a tablet. I do play games but that's not my main use mostly reading watching netflix and using it for work. For the price it is the best out there !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: awesome tablet
Reviews.Author: Joyce McCray
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my daughter and she just loves it.  She is a dancer, does a lot of videos and pictures of performances.  She was so excited and just loves it.

Reviews.Title: so far (after 2 months) very satisfied with the tablet
Reviews.Author: skyfoxx
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to snag it when ASUS was promoting it at Amazon and for a few days the price was incredibly low - 109.95 or smth like that. Compared to how much I paid for my Archos 7 three years ago... well, let's not compare because there is no point.Anyway, here is the short list of Pros and ConsPro:a) the tablet has not crashed even once. I use it every day to read books, watch videos, write emails, browse the web, run some simple utilities, install games and such, but nothing extra-fancyb) with the Wi-Fi constantly on, the battery life is quite impressive. I recharge it once a week (depends on how much I use it, but I am saying on average).c) speed is very good. Much much faster than my old Archos but that goes without saying. Faster than Galaxy Tab 2, that's for sure.d) I found very nice and inexpensive case and accessories for it (tablet kit by Birugear with screen protectors, case, travel chargers etc)e) display is good (not Retina-great quality but very good for my purposes). Unlike some other older displays, the viewing angle is pretty widef) had no problem working with microSD cards, no problems with connecting to my PC to transfer dataCons:a) as I said the screen is OK, not great. Decent... not sure if that can be listed as a con but wthb) some areas of the screen (corners) seem to be slightly less sensitive to the touch than others... not by much but still.c) power and volume buttons are located a bit awkwardly, it  takes a while to start properly pushing them. The other side of the coin (positive side) is that you will never push them by accident (at least not when it is in the Birugear case)OVERALL: for 110 bucks it is an amazing bargain. If I could buy 8 Gb version for, say, 80 dollars, that would be a great present for my kids.

Reviews.Title: Amazing bargain tablet.
Reviews.Author: arivas
Reviews.Content: For the money, it cannot be beat. If your low on cash [I'm a struggling college student] this is the one. I first read about this on Laptop mag and PC mag when I was reviewing cheap tablets. Both of them named the ASUS highly and that was enough for me.

Reviews.Title: I love my tablet...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: ... because It has great graphics, and no lag! My brother has the same tablet, which he would have happily shared with me when I wanted to try it out before I ordered my own, but Now It's been a few days since It has arrived at my mailbox. I would recommend this to a lot of people, including my friends at school, and at the school my brother goes to!

Reviews.Title: An excellent value in terms of performance, usability and quality.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought two ASUS HD 7 tablets, one for my wife and one for my son and they both love them. (I've set up and installed apps on both my wife and 8 yr old son's HD 7 tablets). The tablet is an excellent value for the money and, imo, is currently the best value on the market in its price range. While ASUS makes both the ASUS HD 7 and Google's Nexus 7, I prefer the HD 7 due to its microSD slot (which accepts up to 32GB cards), whereas the Nexus 7 does NOT have a micro SD slot (Google is hoping its Nexus 7 users pay for a subscription to their cloud-based data storage service; in our family's case, we use the HD 7's microSD card along with our own cloud-based server).Everything I've loaded on to our our two HD 7s has ran well and the tablets have been very reliable; one tablet is 3 months old, the other is only a couple of weeks old.I would strongly recommend this tablet to anyone who is in the market for an inexpensive tablet.

Reviews.Title: This is a great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Ghost rider
Reviews.Content: I got one of these at from Micro Center and wow!  this tablet is great!This is my 2nd Android tablet and I have a IPad one.This tablet had no lag moving around on the screen, the battery lasts a long time.I would recommend a screen protector and a case for it.if you want to load movies on it, I would recommend a 16 or 32 gb Micro sd card.But I like it so much we are ordering one for my father-in-law

Reviews.Title: Asus tablet
Reviews.Author: C. F. K. "Fussy"
Reviews.Content: Didn't like at first, couldn't get netflex, but recent update by Asus fixed that! That is why I gave it 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: corrected review-45 days old and died
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Ben"
Reviews.Content: tablet completely died while charging.  i went through all the troubleshooting, cycles, and every permutation of holding down buttons.  It looks like a common issue.what fixed the issue was that the battery is picky and high voltage wall charging can cause an issue from time to time.  I resolved it by charging it via my laptop and USB cable.The tablet itself has mediocre build quality, but the flip side is it is very light.  I dropped it a few feet and the screen shattered, so i would recommend a case.  The hardware and battery life is great.  The screen isn't quite a retina, but you're payinhg $150 for it, instead of $400.  It was a no brainer for me, and the tablet does most nearly anything you would like it to.  In addition, it has expandable storage which most other tablets do not have.Overall a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money!!!!
Reviews.Author: ivan_hrusovsky
Reviews.Content: Worth the money, its fast for gaming, it can handle GPS navigation, music, pictures... Plenty of fun for couple of bucks. You don't need to by any extra sd card, you'll be rewarded with 16Gb of internal storage + 16Gb Asus cloud which is enough. However you may want to have more extra storage - get a micro Sd card. I bought 64Gb. S***ty Apple haters gonna hate, but this tablet has the power of iPad mini, has more storage, is 7" - great to hold in hand, is very cheap. On the other hand, there are two negatives - its heavier then iPad and the charging. I have US version and it charges up just till 40% of capacity here in Europe, the only way to get it fully charged is to connect it to a computer.

Reviews.Title: A great tablet for the money
Reviews.Author: John C "John"
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet. I had no idea what I wanted or needed in a tablet. While reading the reviews here on Amazon of tablets in the $100 range, someone mentioned this one. I was impressed with the Quad Core processor and the 16 Gig of storage. I found the MeMo for $129. I decided to spend the extra money based on the favorable reviews. I am very happy with this tablet. It seems to do everything I want it to do. The 5 megapixel camera is another good feature compared to the cheaper units. I added the 32 gig micro sd card, a Poetic case and a bluetooth keyboard.The MeMo connects to my laptop without a problem. The first thing I did was to transfer the owners manual PDF file to the external card and install the Adobe reader from the Google Store. It does not come with a manual and if your new to tablets, it is well worth reading.I have also installed a couple games and a couple free books from Amazon. My wife bought a cheaper tablet from Walmart which pretty sure eventually she will give to the grandkids. Then I will buy one of these for her.

Reviews.Title: One of the best 7" tablets!
Reviews.Author: Vladimir Buriko
Reviews.Content: Great product - a lot of features offered for very low price. The Micro SD Card Reader Slot is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Anna Smirnova
Reviews.Content: Of course can not be compared to Ipad but for the price it is working great. The screen has very good resolution, though it might be a little more responsive. The tablet itself looks very nice. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great little tablet
Reviews.Author: JAC
Reviews.Content: Already had the Asus transformer prime, but wanted a 7inch tablet to carry around with me. So sfter reading other reviews, purchased this one and I have not been dissapointed. Good build quality and operates like a dream. Quite fast and simple to use. Many built in apps some good and some not so good, but hay ho you only need to use the use the ones you want to.

Reviews.Title: Nice and elegantly built iPad Mini competitor with havled price
Reviews.Author: Ming Yu
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and high quality built Android device.I got it for approx. $130.00 prior to Thanksgiving.I have used Apple iPod and iPad for long time but decided to try Android.Never regretted that I have made a wise decision.This device has a 7" wide screen IPS monitor, which is crystal clear; compared with apple iPad mini, it is equally capable but with halved price.Basically, Google built an equivalent tablet world(i.e. Android tablet OS, Google play Android App, etc) and Asus elegantly implemented the hardware.I especially like the widget feature, which is not provided on Apple devices yet. Probably, Apple has better marketing and I definitely prefer Android over Apple IOS now.

Reviews.Title: Very nice value.  Good on it's own merit.
Reviews.Author: S. Chang Kim "Changster"
Reviews.Content: I thought I made a mistake when I saw the Samsung Tab3 for a similar price, and was going to return it.  When it arrived, my brother who got this compared it to the Samsung Tab3 I got my GF and loves it.  Except for the screen it's a clone of the Google Nexus.  Add some memory and it's good to go.

Reviews.Title: Asus MeMMoPad WONDERFUL!
Reviews.Author: SASS "Sandy Fleming"
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. I've had several quality tablets and this is by far the best. Amazed at this 7". I know Asus is Top of the line,but this new MeMMoPad is so easy to use for hours st a time.I was pleased with shipping time and how easy this was to set up. Turn it on and ready to use in nothing flat.Camera is wonderful with so many cool features. I've made some awesome ones for listing on CL nd EBay..Love it !! Has all I ever need. Just almost like their big tablet.All HD looks great !!

Reviews.Title: the perfect budget HD tablet so far
Reviews.Author: Jorge Maciel
Reviews.Content: I got the previous memo pad tablet (not hd) but the resolution was not so good, for reading was bad since the letters were not clear so I returned it, now I got this one and Im glad I got it, the HD looks really good, you can read newspapers/magazines with no issues, great for the price!

Reviews.Title: problems with SD card slot
Reviews.Author: Chrisleah
Reviews.Content: I had ordered this because of the reasonable price for a 7inch tablet. The battery life is pretty good at around 9 hours. The reason for the poor rating is that the back of the tablet scratches pretty easily (I have a protective case for it now), the problem with external storage my card unmount and remounts a lot. Sometimes the tablet is just lying there on the table when I would hear the 'sound' of the SD card being unmounted sometimes I would be reading book when my book would just disappear then I would have to wait a bit before the book would reappear again, this is very frustrating because I use my tablet a lot for reading books. I have used other SD cards in it to test whether it was my card that was defective but the same thing happened the card kept getting unmounted. I wished someone had told me about the SD card problem because I would never have bought this tablet but the Samsung galaxy tab 3 8 inch instead.

Reviews.Title: Great value, fast, nice, great battery life.
Reviews.Author: Roland Pokornyik
Reviews.Content: This is the best value tablet in the market I think. You get 4 Cores 1 GB ram for less than 200 bucks. Must have!

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: W. Povse
Reviews.Content: Great price for what you get. Never had a tablet before but if you have an android smart phone learning to use this is easy.

Reviews.Title: Home Run Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet because I wanted an upgrade from my Kindle Touch and I was not disappointed! I can still read all my Kindle media through the Kindle app, but there is just so much more to it. Not only can I read, but I can social network, store my crochet patterns and recipes, and game like no one's business. The resolution is great and the speed is great too. My husband has a Galaxy tablet and he is jealous of my Asus. This little tablet really knocks it out of the park!

Reviews.Title: Currently the "Best Buy" for 7 " Android Tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Don
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on 7 inch Android tablets looking to replace my first exposure and purchase of an Acer A110. While a decent tablet at the time, it had the all the desired features but lacked that "brilliant screen"This tablet has it ALL except a mini HDMI. It is basically a Nexus (Asus makes Nexus) BUT with a Micro SD slot (a very desirable feature) at great price. Its screen is "brilliant" enough for the average user. The OS is close to Vanilla Android. What Asus does change is good.Besides the hardware,  Asus includes some App's that are REALLY USEFUL and User Friendly, even compared to some comparable apps one can get on the store. Two notable apps are  their "To-Do" list (VERY WELL thought out and easy to use) and  SuperNote Lite. SuperNote is an app where one can make separate notebooks and take notes via writing with ones finger (or stylus), typing or voice via the voice key on the keyboard. One can also "draw" in multiple colors and SEND notebook pages via email or other options to others.It also comes with a decent app for organizing and reading your epub (and other format) books once you learn how easy it is to get free books from sites like FeedBooks etc.  I like book readers that have that "real page turning" feature and this does.I almost forgot, it has a great "File Manager" as well !They have some mini "floating apps" which help one multi-task. I especially like the floating mail and video play apps (which can be expanded if and when desired). Very Cool..Includes keyboard that can be set up with "Swipe" functionality  (another desirable feature) and it has good battery life.You REALLY get a "bang for your buck" at this point in time with this model, the features and included apps.If you are in the market for a 7" Android, stop looking, shop for the best price, buy and start using using your time enjoying and being productive.. !

Reviews.Title: nice overall product
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: Does not support Adobe flash.  Otherwise, would be 5 stars.  Cameras could use some improvements.  Overall, very happy with the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Mark Lundgren
Reviews.Content: This is a great little tablet.  The screen is awesome.  The sound is good.  It's pretty fast.  I had an issue with the SD card unmounting but Amazon hooked me up and sent me a new one. Then I got a Sony micro SD card and I don't have that issue.  This does everything I need it to. I play games, check emails, fantasy football.... all that. I don't watch movies on it but I have looked at HD video online and the screen was great.  Battery last forever.  Great tablet for the money.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the Price
Reviews.Author: Damodar Chandru
Reviews.Content: I know there are better Tablets then this, but this one is doing all I expected out of it without a glitch. For the price I paid, this is an excellent tab and does go through the job in a decent manner.There was sum sticky thing on the screen when it arrived, when I held it I realised the sticky thing is exactly where you put your finger on the screen.The tab was dead and had obsolutely no charge let, even after plugging in it wouldn't start for 10 mins or so.Pros -1. Resolution is decent for the price2. Almost Stock Android3. Snappy for normal activities4. Decent on GamesCons -1. Camera is pathetic for 5 MP2. On/Off and Volume button are placed awkardly3. The flig mechanism is slow when you go from potrait to landscape.Overall, a good bet for the price.

Reviews.Title: Bargain shopping pays off!
Reviews.Author: ktarantino
Reviews.Content: We were debating between the new Kindle and this ASUS tablet.  I ended up going with the ASUS (my boyfriend went with the Kindle) after reading the highly revered amazon reviews and they were spot on again.  My son likes to tote it along with him to read and the 7 inch fits well in his bag/jacket pocket. The price of course was a huge selling point.  My son absolutely loves it and wasn't interested in trying out any other versions of tablets after using this for a week.  I have a nexus 7 and the ASUS looks and works just as good if not better. He said he finds himself using his computer much less because his tablet is so convenient and fast.  I also own an ASUS laptop and have had such success with it, I was fairly confident with the brand.  Highly recommend to anyone wanting a good tablet for a great price.

Reviews.Title: it's what i had hoped for
Reviews.Author: MATTHEW EDDY
Reviews.Content: Really love this tablet, does everything I want and has the ability to expand it's storage with the micro sd slot.  Screen can be a little bad with glare but a matte finish screen protector really helped cut that down.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Rick Paterala
Reviews.Content: Best tablet I have found for the price.  Not complaints as of yet, wifi connection extends the entire range of the home over 3,000 sq ft.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Kandace Roque
Reviews.Content: I have had it for a few days now and I love it! The screen display is crystal clear. Movies and TV shows look perfect. I love the color on the back. It is extremely thin so I will be looking into getting a cover for it. Both cameras are surprising good and take a decent picture. I was pleasantly surprised at how long the battery lasted, about 11 hours. It runs smoothly, the apps open up and load within 2 seconds. I know people who have the Galaxy Tab 3 and it runs the same, if not better. If you are looking for a tablet and don't want to pay $200 or more, this is the one!

Reviews.Title: My Daughter Loves it
Reviews.Author: Rocket Rancher "Laura"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter; she's a junior in college. Said she didn't need a tablet so much to take notes, but needed it to keep electronic "handouts" the professors give her. She loves it and I am jealous. I'm thinking of getting myself one.

Reviews.Title: ASUS MeMOPad HD 7-Inch 16 GB Tablet, Blue (ME173X-A1-BL)
Reviews.Author: Beatlelover
Reviews.Content: Fantastic... Great sound, very responsive... Picture is crystal clear, very comfortable to hold in one hand... Tried a basic Acer Iconia before purchasing the ASUS, the ASUS put it to shame... I wish I had the money to hand these out to family and friends... I have an ASUS laptop and have had it about 6 mos; love ASUS products! Thank you for a wonderful product!

Reviews.Title: Memo Pad Android 4.2 issue
Reviews.Author: Planker
Reviews.Content: The tablet is excellent for the price. The only major issue is that there are no physical navigation buttons, only soft keys.The soft key bar takes up almost a 1/2" of diagonal screen space, reducing the actual screen size to 6.5".Asus needs to work with Google to create an Android update that will allow full screen by hiding the soft keys or making them semitransparent. This would greatly improve the user experience.

Reviews.Title: MicroSD problem
Reviews.Author: Hung N.
Reviews.Content: It's working good. But there was a little bit problem. When I tried to move it around, then MicroSD card slot won't recognize my "microSD" and I put on table micrSD works again.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Marie Daniels
Reviews.Content: My first tablet yeah! Its pretty nice for the price and really easy to setup. The manual says that you should fully charge it before turning it on for the first time. Didn't take long to do that. Also within a few minutes there was a OS upgrade that took about 15 minutes to download and install. Its not to heavy, looks nice and for the price I can get past the finger prints lol. Also make sure to go online and register it. Anyway I would recommend if you need this one buy it.

Reviews.Title: Tablet
Reviews.Author: Cindy R. Triplett
Reviews.Content: This was a purchase made by my husband.  It is exactly what he wanted, and therefore makes me happy (not dealing with his unhappiness)

Reviews.Title: Great Value for your money
Reviews.Author: diego
Reviews.Content: What an awesome tablet, this device's screen it's awesome for the price point, the performance is more than adequate, at least for my girlfriend that just plays The Simpsons and UNO and open like 15 tabs on Chrome, runs all without problems, battery life is good too but what we're in love is with the design and that beautiful green color. The cameras suck but that was not the reason we bought it. For the price point go get a device with a decent screen, good overall performance, good size and good speaker output. Fully recommended

Reviews.Title: New Tablet - A Great Value
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "MrCTX1"
Reviews.Content: The ASUS MeMOPad HD7 is a great little tablet for the price.  I was considering several others, with the main contender being the Kindle Fire HD.  This won out because of full Android functionality, SD-card port, and price.  I have not regretted the choice, two weeks in use.  I will update again in a few weeks.Here are the negatives:  Adobe is no longer supporting Flash, so Amazon Prime Instant Videos do not work - I somehow missed that when doing my prelim work.  This might change if Amazon upgrades to HTML5 for its video feeds.  The other negative is the lack of a mini-HDMI port.  While neither of these are huge issues for me, they are important enough for most tablet seekers to warrant the note and the lack of the 5th star.The first sentence really says it - this is a great tablet for the price.  If I could I would rate it 4+.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Paula S "History Buff"
Reviews.Content: Did not want a  Kindle because I have a Nook but love that the Kindle app works great for me on the MeMo. Great size and I have no problems with it at all. In fact I use it much more than my IPad !

Reviews.Title: I love my ASUS MemoPad HD 7-Inch
Reviews.Author: Ms. G.
Reviews.Content: I've only had my ASUS for a short time but so far it is much more than I expected for the price. It's quick and it has loads of apps.  I also find it quite user friendly.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE my tablet!
Reviews.Author: Jennem
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say that I did not have unreasonable expectations for a tablet selling for only $149 and I am more than happy with what Asus delivered for the price. It does everything I need it to do - browsing, simple games, music, streaming video, Kindle Reader App, etc - and it handles most tasks smoothly enough.Some reviewers mentioned that their micro sd cards unmount randomly, but mine works great. I can access my music directly from the card using the "Play Music" app and the sound is pretty good, especially in "movie mode".The screen is bright and crisp and while I sometimes have to tap it more than once, it is generally responsive. Many online reviewers have complained about the quality and feel of the Memo Pad, but it's really not that bad. I would not even have notice the slight overlap of the back cover if it had not specifically been pointed out to me.Another common complaint is that the power button and volume rocker is in an awkward spot towards the back of the tablet. Actually, when holding the device in your left hand in the portrait position, the volume rocker is positioned perfectly to be reached with the fingers of your left hand, thus leaving your right hand free. It works equally well in the landscape position.The only negative I can think of is that Jelly Bean did not update automatically on my device to the 4.2.2 version for me yet and I am not sure how to fix this.All in all this is a very good product and the shipping from Amazon was super fast!

Reviews.Title: impressed
Reviews.Author: GTR
Reviews.Content: i own several ipads and minis, love them.ive bought the original nexus 7 and more recently a galaxy tab 2 7" - was not impressed with either relative to the ipads.all these devices seem like science fiction miracles to me, so "not impressed" is only relative to ipad standards.the memopad 7 hd arrived yesterday, and i'm very impressed!  fast performance, clear crisp screen, and android 4.2 right out of the box.  for $149 a very good value in my opinion, and viable alternative to a mini on many counts.

Reviews.Title: just love this asus table
Reviews.Author: carribbean girl
Reviews.Content: this is my first tablet and im loving every second of it. it fast and reliable and connect to WiFi very quickly. the tablet does not feel cheap to me at all. Have no problem with this item at all.

Reviews.Title: Personal Use
Reviews.Author: anthony mcdaniel
Reviews.Content: Handy little tablet, makes ease for reading headlines and notes. Books may come later, but for now the convenience of emails and news is great.

Reviews.Title: Decent performance and low price
Reviews.Author: Pikmin
Reviews.Content: ASUS Memo Pad, is targeted mainly at the low end market. With the price point of 129 for an 8gb model and 149 for the 16gb model. Which is drastically cheaper than the original Nexus 7 and the new Nexus 7. ASUS did cut the corners in all the right places in order to cheap down the cost. On the screen we have 1280x800 panel very similar to the Nexus 7 but you are not going to get that laminated look. It washes out a little easier at different angles and has an appreciable gap on the side. So it is a lower quality display but for the price it is not that bad. On the inside we have a ASUS quad core A7 1gb of ram. The performance seems snappy with Android 4.1. There are quick launch apps on the home screen with different options to launch Google now or Gmail.  So for the price 129-149 is hard to complain, it performs above that price class. It hard to recommend over the original Nexus 7 which has dip down in price if you can find one. Compare Memo Pad with other low end tablet this is the best way to go in the budget class.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: JayE
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a birthday gift for our daughter and she loves the tablet. Very easy to set up. Very responsive. Really easy to navigate. The camera is one of the best feature that our daughter likes the most. I would definitely recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: A great Android tablet, and economic too...
Reviews.Author: gary
Reviews.Content: A very good purchase. I use the tablet daily, and I'm satisfied that for my surfing, email, limited online poker playing I chose well. My experience so far regarding battery life, between 6-8hrs per charge. I recommend this tablet without reservation.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Ali
Reviews.Content: This is Great. I bought this for my dad and you will get very good product for small price.The software is good and the battery works fro almost 10 hours.I would recommend it for anyone.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Cable Dog
Reviews.Content: Got it for my wife (pretty pink). Have used it myself (the pink helping me to get in touch with my feminine side). Wife is satisfied. I am very satisfied. Good price. Happy wife.  An old married man could not ask for anything more. This old IT tech believes it is a good piece of technology.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Candy Cane
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by the high quality of this little, inexpensive tablet. Our house has two iPads, a Samsung Tab 3 10.1 and a Blackberry Playbook. This tablet isn't as cool as the iPads, and it is not as sturdy as the Playbook, but it really does hold its own in most areas.This is a great little tablet for a child to young adult or for the budget conscious. Streaming videos works well. the sound is better than i expected. It works great, has micro sd for added memory (which beats the he** out of iPad) and seems to be a very good purchase. I use mine for travel in case I leave for forget it somewhere, at least it isn't a huge financial blow.Recommended

Reviews.Title: Asus' best kept secret.  Phenomenal 7in android tablet
Reviews.Author: DEAN St Hill
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a 7in tablet for my daughter and after lots of research I decided on this. Everything is to love about this tablet - I got a hot pink for my daughter and she loves it. The screen is wonderful. Bright. High definition. Sound equally good. The tablet is no sloth with its quad core processor powering it through every app I threw at it.Its 16g of memory is good and its enhanced through a micro-sd slot. It does justice to multi media of all types with HD movies looking outstanding.Wifi seems to work nicely and I see access points I don't see on other devices.I'll be looking at Asus for future products and already have eyes on the 10 inch Asus Memo Pad FHD which also looks to be a great tablet.This tablet is not without flaws. I am not clear whether USB on the go is supported and it would have been nice to have an hdmi output but then its a sub $150 tablet.Bottom line: Asus has a winner and this should do well as its a great device for its price and maybe still a great bargain if it cost 50 bucks more.

Reviews.Title: just right for the price
Reviews.Author: Earthgirl
Reviews.Content: Amazon send another one  to replace the first and it came fast fedex the next day, They were very helpfull. I would consider getting another. perfect for the kids and so far no problems with this one. Get them protected. just plastic backing. but internally well rounded good quality.

Reviews.Title: great value for your money
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: I bought this for the wife as a gift, and just recently got a chance to play around with it. I currently have a samsung galaxy tab and my baby is my nexus 7 (2012). first off I'd have to say I was impressed almost immediately once I started scrolling through her screens, this thing is snappy. running on android 4.2.1 right out of the box. the memo pad hd7 ran very fluid, and the screen really popped. I immediately had to watch some videos on netflix to compare and petty much as most reviews state both the picture and audio was quite impressive. neither of us are hard core gamers but we both play a lot of casual games so of course I had to try "angry birds star wars", and just for the hell of it "temple run 2" both ran perfect, no stuttering or lag. I took a few pictures and from what I know of tablet cameras, it seemed pretty good. As far as build quality goes, our HD7 is actually pretty solid, I see a lot of reviews knocking the plasticy feel and creekiness. I don't know, maybe its a little bit of hit and miss in that department. my N7 definitely feels more solid, but overall it wouldn't be anything that would stop me from buying. I would highly recommend for anyone looking for a sub $200 tablet. it's made by ASUS the people who made the nexus 7 so that alone should give you a piece of mind. I'd say this little guy is about right on par with the 2012 N7, if not maybe a half step up.

Reviews.Title: very good for the price, a few drawbacks
Reviews.Author: DeadlyGalaxy
Reviews.Content: Bought a blue ASUS MeMOPad HD 7 to replace a IPad 2.  At first was a bit hesitant because I'd never used Android OS before, but with $150-$200+ difference between this and a IPad 3/4, decided to give this a try, especially after reading overwhelming positive reviews both here and on tech sites.Got it last week, my impressions so far is, for the price it's a excellent tablet.  It doesn't have some of the high end functions that more expensive tablets have, like mini HDMI or camera flash, but small grips on the whole.  And the housing seems to be a bit less durable than other tablets (IPad), but easily fixed with a nice protective case/cover.  Also the Google Play store isn't as robust in offerings as the Apple AppStore at the moment, but quickly catching up.It's got a nice, easy to use operating system (especially after it updated OS version), tablet screen itself is nice (not quite as sharp as with the Retina IPads or higher end tablets, but still quite nice) and responsive (i'm sure in no small reason of the x4 cores), screen itself seems to be quite responsive to finger tapping and dragging. Memory and slowdowns don't seem to be a problem, and even though it only has 16 gigs of storage memory onboard, it's easily enough fixed with a 32 gig micro sd card ($20-25 here on Amazon) and have read that you can use even higher sized micro SD cards, once formatted properly.So far it's done quite well, main uses are for Facebook, light web usage, picture album and some games here and there.  Definitely would recommend to anyone looking for a cheaper/starter tablet without sacrificing performance and build.  I've had several ASUS products in the past and have been very pleased with their quality and price, will definitely consider them again in the future for upgrade/replacement.

Reviews.Title: Excellent budget tablet.
Reviews.Author: Max Harry Johnson
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a family member so I only get the privilege of setting it up and playing with it a little.Screen:The MemoPad have a nicer screen than the original (2012) Nexus 7 despite similar resolution. Fonts are 'sharp' and colors are very vibrant. Screen angle is good. HD videos will look very nice on it. Asus included an app called "Splendid" which allows you to control the hue, saturation and temperature of the display, a very nice touch.Build:The device is light and easy to hold with one hand for a prolonged period, good for reading on bed. It's probably not a durable tablet and the screen is not made of Gorilla glass so buying a case and screen protector to avoid scratches is a must.Usage:This tablet is ideal for web browsing, ebook, video chat, and especially watching videos and streaming. The processor should be adequate for all these tasks with few stutters. However, it's highly recommended to speed up the device by installing a third party launcher and disabling built-in apps you don't need. It's GPS actually gets good signal and can get a location fix in a short time so it could be ideal for offline maps. With support of microSD card you can load in a lot of media. It will struggle for realistic 3D games. It was very choppy with Asphalt 7, but general popular games like Temple Run, etc is no problem.I can't confirm the battery life, but the general consensus seems that the MediaTek processor in this tablet is energy efficient which warrant Asus's claim of 10hours battery life. This may coincide with the device staying cool. It does get warm on the top half of the tablet for intensive tasks, but not too uncomfortable.Comparing to the Nexus 7: Comparing to the original (2012) Nexus 7, this MemoPad have a better screen, slightly better speaker I think, rear camera, microSD slot, longer battery life, but somewhat lower performance. However, if you can spend more money, the newer generation Nexus 7 is going to be a much better choice since its at least twice faster and have a rear camera as well. However, Nexus devices never gets microSD slot which can be a minus, this is the primary reason why the person I bought this tablet for wanted it instead of the Nexus 7.A nice bonus, they included a cheap tablet stand in the box.Update: It seems the 4.2.1 firmware of this device it experienced incompatibility issues with a few games, but only a tiny few so I wouldn't be worried. The games that crashed when I tried to run are Fruit Ninja, Let's Golf 3 and Flow. Most other popular games work without problems. I'm sure Asus will fix this in their future updates.

Reviews.Title: Great gift for the wife...Powerful for the price
Reviews.Author: B
Reviews.Content: I bought this in the "pink" model for my wife as she was often asking to borrow my tablet around the house. For 150 bucks, this is a heck of a tablet for only a 7" model. I bought my Acer A700 when they first hit shelves for around 350 bucks and while it is a dual core with the same specs as this 7", after getting this tablet setup for my wife I could tell the difference between the processing speed from my A700 versus this Memo Pad HD.
